name: Generating Tax Summaries from Stripe, Storing in Google Sheets, and Sending Slack Alerts
description:
## Description
Automatically generate multi-jurisdiction tax summaries from Stripe invoices and sync them into Google Sheets with daily reporting. This workflow ensures compliance-ready tax data, detailed breakdowns by country/state/tax rate, and real-time Slack notifications for both success and error handling. 💳📈📢

## What This Template Does
- Triggers daily at 2:00 AM using a scheduled cron. ⏰
- Fetches paid invoices from Stripe (last 30 days). 💳
- Validates data integrity before processing. ✅
- Summarizes taxes by period, country, state, and rate. 🧮
- Formats and logs results in Google Sheets for reporting. 📊
- Sends Slack notifications for both success and failure. 📢

## Key Benefits
- Automated tax compliance reporting. 🧾
- Accurate multi-jurisdiction tracking. 🌍
- Eliminates manual spreadsheet work. ⏱️
- Maintains a historical audit trail. 📋
- Real-time notifications keep your team informed. 🔔
- Built-in error handling ensures reliability. 🛡️

## Features
- Daily cron schedule (0 2 * * *).
- Stripe invoices fetched with expanded tax amounts.
- Intelligent grouping by period, country, state, and tax rate.
- Google Sheets integration with append/update logic.
- Success Slack message: summary totals, record count, period.
- Error Slack message: troubleshooting guidance and failure logs.
- Uses environment variables for secure configuration (GOOGLE_SHEETS_DOCUMENT_ID, SLACK_CHANNEL_ID).

## Requirements
- n8n instance (cloud or self-hosted).
- Stripe API credentials with invoice read access.
- Google Sheets OAuth2 credentials with write access.
- Slack API credentials with chat:write permissions.
- Proper tax configuration in Stripe for accurate reporting.

## Target Audience
- Finance teams handling recurring billing and tax filings. 💼
- Accountants needing automated jurisdiction tax breakdowns. 📊
- SaaS businesses managing global customers. 🌐
- Agencies and SMEs streamlining monthly tax reporting. 🏢
- Remote teams requiring real-time workflow notifications. 📲

## Step-by-Step Setup Instructions
- Configure Stripe API credentials in n8n.
- Set up Google Sheets with a “Tax Summary” sheet (columns: period, country, state, tax rate, taxable amount, tax collected, processing date).
- Configure Slack API credentials and channel ID (e.g., tax-reports).
- Replace hardcoded values with environment variables for security.
- Import this workflow JSON into n8n.
- Run once manually with test invoices to validate.
- Enable the workflow for daily automated reporting. ✅

workflow.name: Stripe Tax Summary to Google Sheets with Slack Alerts

parameters.content:
## 📊 Stripe Tax Summary Reporting Automation

This workflow automatically generates comprehensive tax summaries from your Stripe invoices, providing detailed breakdowns by country, state, and tax rate for compliance and reporting purposes.

### What this workflow does:
• Fetches paid invoices from Stripe daily at 2 AM
• Analyzes tax data from the last 30 days
• Calculates tax summaries by jurisdiction and rate
• Updates Google Sheets with formatted tax reports
• Sends Slack notifications with processing results
• Maintains complete audit trail for tax compliance

### Key Benefits:
• Automated tax compliance reporting
• Multi-jurisdiction tax tracking
• Real-time tax data analysis
• Professional reporting format
• Error handling and notifications
• Historical tax data preservation

### Setup Requirements:
1. Stripe account with invoice tax data
2. Google Sheets for tax report storage
3. Slack workspace for notifications
4. Proper tax configuration in Stripe

## ⏰ Daily Tax Processing Schedule

Runs every day at 2 AM to process tax data from the previous 30 days.

**Cron Expression:** `0 2 * * *`
- 0: minute (0)
- 2: hour (2 AM)
- *: any day of month
- *: any month
- *: any day of week

**Why 2 AM?**
• Low system usage time
• Ensures daily processing
• Allows overnight Stripe data sync
• Consistent reporting schedule

💡 **Optimization:** Adjust timing based on your business timezone and tax reporting requirements.

## 💳 Stripe Invoice Data Retrieval

Fetches paid invoices with expanded tax information from Stripe API.

**Current Issues:**
- Using HTTP Request instead of native Stripe node
- Manual API endpoint management
- Hardcoded query parameters

**Query Parameters:**
- `status=paid`: Only paid invoices
- `limit=100`: Maximum 100 invoices per request
- `expand[]=data.lines.data.tax_amounts`: Include tax details
- `created[gte]`: Last 30 days of data

**Recommendation:**
Use native Stripe node for better:
- Error handling
- Parameter validation
- Maintenance
- Documentation

nodes.name: Fetch Paid Invoices with Tax Data

parameters.content:
## ✅ Data Validation Check

Validates that invoice data was successfully retrieved before processing.

**Validation Logic:**
- Checks if data array exists
- Verifies data array has length > 0
- Prevents processing empty datasets

**Error Handling:**
- Success path: Continue to tax processing
- Failure path: Send error notification

**Why This Matters:**
- Prevents workflow failures on empty data
- Provides clear error messaging
- Maintains data integrity
- Enables proper troubleshooting

## 🧮 Tax Data Processing Engine

Advanced tax calculation and summary generation from Stripe invoice data.

**Processing Logic:**
1. **Period Grouping**: Groups by year-month (YYYY-MM)
2. **Jurisdiction Mapping**: Extracts country and state information
3. **Tax Rate Analysis**: Calculates by tax rate percentage
4. **Amount Aggregation**: Sums taxable amounts and taxes collected
5. **Currency Conversion**: Converts from cents to dollars

**Data Structures:**
- Uses Map for efficient grouping
- Handles nested invoice line items
- Processes multiple tax jurisdictions
- Accounts for tax-exempt transactions

**Output Format:**
- Period, country, state, tax rate
- Taxable amount, tax collected
- Rounded to 2 decimal places

## 📋 Data Preparation for Sheets

Formats tax summary data for Google Sheets logging.

**Data Mapping:**
- Period: YYYY-MM format
- Country: ISO country code
- State: State/province code
- Tax Rate: Percentage value
- Taxable Amount: Dollar amount
- Tax Collected: Dollar amount

**Data Types:**
- Strings for identifiers
- Numbers for monetary values
- Consistent formatting

**Quality Assurance:**
- Validates data types
- Ensures proper formatting
- Handles null/empty values

## 📊 Google Sheets Tax Report

**Security Issues:**
- Hardcoded Google Sheets document ID exposed
- Personal email in credential name

**Fix Required:**
Replace hardcoded values with environment variables:
- `$env.GOOGLE_SHEETS_DOCUMENT_ID`
- `$env.GOOGLE_SHEETS_SHEET_NAME`

**Sheet Configuration:**
- Append or update operation
- Auto-map input data
- Proper column schema
- Data type conversion

**Report Features:**
- Historical tax data
- Multi-jurisdiction tracking
- Automated updates
- Audit trail maintenance

## 📢 Success Notification Setup

**Security Issues:**
- Hardcoded Slack channel ID exposed
- Personal credential reference

**Fix Required:**
Replace hardcoded values with environment variables:
- `$env.SLACK_CHANNEL_ID`

**Notification Content:**
- Processing completion status
- Record count processed
- Period information
- Timestamp for reference

**Message Format:**
- Professional formatting
- Key metrics summary
- Actionable information
- Clear success indication

## ❌ Error Notification Setup

**Security Issues:**
- Hardcoded Slack channel ID exposed
- Personal credential reference

**Fix Required:**
Replace with environment variables:
- `$env.SLACK_CHANNEL_ID`

**Error Information:**
- Clear error description
- Node failure identification
- Timestamp for troubleshooting
- Action guidance

**Troubleshooting:**
- Links to workflow execution
- Common issue guidance
- Contact information
- Next steps for resolution

parameters.text:
❌ **Tax Summary Workflow Failed**

🚨 **Error Details:**
• Issue: No invoice data found or data validation failed
• Possible Causes:
  - No paid invoices in the last 30 days
  - Stripe API connection issues
  - Missing tax configuration in Stripe
  - Network connectivity problems

🕒 **Failed At:** {{ new Date().toLocaleString() }}

🔧 **Troubleshooting Steps:**
1. Check Stripe API credentials
2. Verify invoice data exists for the period
3. Review Stripe tax configuration
4. Check n8n execution logs

💬 **Support:** Please check the workflow execution details in n8n dashboard
⏰ **Next Retry:** Tomorrow at 2:00 AM

main.node: Fetch Paid Invoices with Tax Data

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
